title: Repository Guidelines
text: R/: package source organized concern (initialization.R, composition.R, config_overrides.R, etc.). inst/tinytest/: tinytest suites split functionality (test_initialize.R, test_compose.R, etc.). inst/examples/: YAML fixtures used tests. man/: generated Rd documentation (roxygen2). Root metadata tooling: DESCRIPTION, NAMESPACE, README.qmd, README.md, Makefile, CHANGES.md.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: make document: regenerate NAMESPACE/man/ via roxygen2 render README.qmd README.md. make test: build, install, run tinytest tests. make testone TESTFILE=inst/tinytest/test_initialize.R: run single test file development. make check: run full package checks devtools::check('.'). make install: document install locally (without dependency installation). make clean: remove *.Rcheck directories source tarballs.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Use 4-space indentation snake_case identifiers. Internal helpers follow .name (dot prefix internals); exported API uses plain names (example, initialize, compose). Validate function inputs checkmate entry points. Add/maintain roxygen comments exported functions; edit generated files man/ hand.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Framework: tinytest (tests/tinytest.R package test entrypoint). Name new tests test_<feature>.R keep reusable fixtures inst/examples/. behavior changes, add assertions defaults resolution, override parsing, initialization state transitions, tree-print output. Run make test opening PR; use make testone focused debugging loops.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: .git history present workspace snapshot; use consistent imperative commit subjects scope helpful (example: fix: parse quoted override paths). Keep commits focused include tests/docs user-facing changes. PRs contain: summary changes, rationale, test evidence (make test /make check), explicit notes breaking API changes (update CHANGES.md relevant).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: hydraR R package ports Facebook/Meta’s Hydra configuration composition framework R. enables hierarchical YAML config composition defaults lists, CLI-style overrides, OmegaConf-style interpolation resolvers. API: public API minimal: initialize() compose(). Composed configs returned HydraConfig S3 objects (behave like lists enhanced printing).

title: CLAUDE.md
code: make install        # Install the package locally (no deps) make testall        # Build, install, and run all tinytest tests make testone TESTFILE=inst/tinytest/test_initialize.R  # Run a single test file make document       # Regenerate roxygen2 docs + render README.qmd → README.md make check          # Full R CMD check make clean          # Remove build artifacts

title: CLAUDE.md
text: package follows two-phase pattern: initialize (point config root) → compose (resolve defaults + apply overrides).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: initialize.R — Initialization API state management. Exports initialize() manages package-level state .initialize_state environment. Handles config path resolution initialization assertions. compose.R — Core composition engine exported compose() function. Orchestrates: primary config loading → defaults resolution → group config merging → overrides application → interpolation resolution. Returns HydraConfig S3 object. config_defaults.R — Defaults list parsing normalization. Handles _self_ positioning, group→option entries, config-path entries defaults: key YAML configs. config_overrides.R — CLI-style override parsing application. Supports key=value, +key=value, ~key syntax dot-path navigation, booleans, null, numbers, inline YAML. config_merge.R — Deep merge implementation named lists (right overwrites left, recursively).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: config_interpolation.R — Interpolation resolution engine. Handles ${...} expressions cycle detection, relative paths (., ..), bracket notation ([0], ['key']). Dispatches resolver functions oc.* calls. resolver_dispatch.R — Resolver dispatch logic. Routes oc.env, oc.select, oc.decode, oc.create, oc.deprecated, oc.dict.keys, oc.dict.values implementations. resolver_oc_env.R — ${oc.env:VAR,default} resolver environment variables. resolver_oc_select.R — ${oc.select:path,default} resolver safe config lookups fallback. resolver_oc_decode.R — ${oc.decode:string} resolver base64 decoding. resolver_oc_create.R — ${oc.create:{...}} resolver inline YAML/list construction. resolver_oc_deprecated.R — ${oc.deprecated:...} resolver deprecation warnings. resolver_oc_dict.R — ${oc.dict.keys:path} ${oc.dict.values:path} resolvers dictionary introspection. resolver_utils.R — Shared resolver utilities (argument parsing, quote stripping, etc.).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: config_utils.R — Low-level configuration utilities: dot-path tokenization quote support, nested list get/set operations (.get_cfg_value, .set_cfg_value), unquoted character search (.first_unquoted_index). print.R — S3 print method HydraConfig. Renders configs ASCII trees configurable depth (controlled levels argument options(hydraR.print.max_depth = n)).

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Internal functions use .name naming (dot prefix internals). Parameter validation uses checkmate package. Documentation roxygen2-generated (man/ files edited hand). Tests live inst/tinytest/ split functionality, YAML fixtures inst/examples/. Test fixtures include group structure: db/mysql.yaml, db/postgres.yaml, config.yaml, config_alt.yaml, config_interp.yaml.

title: Command line

code: #!/usr/bin/env Rscript  options(     hydraR.main.config_path = "/path/to/config/",     hydraR.main.config_name = "minimal" )  square <- function(cfg) {     x <- cfg$numeric     out <- sprintf("Input=%s -> Square=%s", x, x^2)     print(out) }  cube <- function(cfg) {     x <- cfg$numeric     out <- sprintf("Input=%s -> Square=%s", x, x^3)     print(out) }  hydraR::main(square) hydraR::main(cube)

title: Manage Configuration Files in YAML
text: Modern data analysis projects need store retrieve many configuration settings, secret keys tokens, paths, tuning parameters, database ports, authentication values. hydraR package R provides easy--use, powerful, flexible workflow manage configuration settings stored YAML files. hydraR uses reticulate implement convenience wrappers around two popular Python libraries. OmegaConf hierarchical configuration system interpolation resolvers. Hydra composition framework built OmegaConf defaults-driven configuration runtime overrides. README shows minimal examples core functionality package. complex features illustrated separate vignettes: change config parameters fly. use interpolation, environment variables, dynamic, interdependent fields config files. combine multiple config files defaults overrides. run R scripts command line multi-run sweep grids parameter values.
